item.title: Novel de-novo Short-Read Genome Assembler
item.description:
Status: Ongoing (Since Jan 2021)

I am working as a student researcher at Advanced Data Analytics and Parallel Technologies (ADAPT) Lab, BITS Pilani with Prof. Poonam Goyal. Sequence assemby is an NP-hard problem which can be modelled as a variant of string reconstruction problem. We are building a novel de-novo short-read genome assembler to reconstruct the contigs efficiently. The proposed assembler is being built with distributed and hierarchical data structures and using intermediaries, unitigs, to avoid the bottlenecks. We harness overlap and paired-end information along with some novel features to extend the unitigs.
